properties.otherAdvice:
Special event clearways will be in place at the following locations to facilitate Sydney Trains trackwork replacement bus operations:

•  Chalmers Street, Surry Hills. Western side of Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street and eastern side between Cleveland Street and Rutland Street

•   Gibbons Street, Redfern. Both western and eastern sides between Chapel Lane and Marian Street.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones and also apply to local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Special event clearways will be in place at the following locations to facilitate Sydney Trains trackwork replacement bus operations:

  • Clarence Street, Sydney CBD. Both western and eastern sides between Barrack Street and Margaret Street
  • York Street, Sydney CBD. Western side only between Margaret Street and Barrack Street

Clarence St will be affected northbound, York St southbound.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones and also apply to local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Christmas - City of Sydney events

properties.publicTransport: The nearest transport hubs are Martin Place, Town Hall and QVB. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Christmas – Santa’s Sydney Sleigh Ride and Tree Lighting will include the lighting of the Martin Place Christmas tree and a Santa sleigh ride from Circular Quay to Martin Place, followed by a fireworks display.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads in the Sydney CBD during the busy Thursday evening peak.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions will be in place to safely facilitate the sleigh ride.

  • From 5pm to 9:30pm, Pitt St will be closed between Hunter St and King St. Motorists will be detoured via Castlereagh St, follow the directions of traffic controllers and allow extra travel time.
  • Access for local residents and businesses on Pitt St north and south of Martin Place will be permitted under two-way traffic conditions entering from Hunter or King Streets. Traffic controllers will be on site. No-through traffic beyond Martin Place from either direction will be permitted during the closure period.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on surrounding roads.
Bikers Toy Run from Ballast Grounds Stockton to Connolly Park Carrington for the motorcycle convoy.

Post Malone at The Domain. Gates open at 6pm, event finish around 11pm.

Up to 28,000 fans are expected to attend the concert at the Phillip Precinct in The Domain.

Some roads around The Domain will close for crowd safety before, during and after the event.

  • Art Gallery Rd will be closed at Hospital Rd from 8pm.
  • Sections of Macquarie Rd, College St, Cathedral St, Hospital Rd, Prince Albert Rd, St Mary’s Rd and St James Rd will be closed from 10pm.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Hospital Rd at Art Gallery Rd.

arrangementElements.html:
Roads within and around The Domain will close for crowd safety before, during and after the event.

  • Art Gallery Rd will be closed at Hospital Rd from 8pm.

After the concert, the following roads will close from 10pm until 12.30am at the direction of NSW Police:

  • College St from Park St to Prince Albert Rd
  • Cathedral St at St Marys Rd
  • Hospital Rd from Art Gallery Rd to Shakespeare Pl
  • Macquarie St from Hunter St to Prince Albert Rd

  • St James Rd from Elizabeth St to Macquarie St

properties.otherAdvice:
AFC Cup: Central Coast Mariners v Terengganu  FC at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off from 7pm, full time around 9pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close before the match between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Randwick Christmas Festival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 2:45am, last race at 6:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races, particularly in the evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Festival Stakes Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12:20pm, last race from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.Festival Stakes Day

Sustainable Christmas Market at The Coal Loader Centre for Sustainability. Event starts at 3pm and finishes at 8pm.

Roads are expected to be busy in the area and parking near the event is limited.

Motorists are advised to travel with their group and plan to arrive early to secure a parking space.

roads.crossStreet: The Coal Loader Centre for Sustainability

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Adelaide United at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 5pm, full time approx 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Melbourne Victory at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off from 3pm, full time around 5pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close before the match between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Perth Glory at Allianz Stadium. Kick-Off at 7:45pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Traffic delays are expected on roads approaching Moore Park and heavy traffic is also expected after the match as nearby music festival finishes at the same time.

Motorists should expect delays and allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Road & Cycleway Closures

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • Sections of Driver Ave, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd will be closed from 8pm to midnight.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave however access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd. Please note EP2 grass car park will not be open for this match.
  • Access to the Entertainment Quarter from 8pm to midnight will be via Oatley Rd, Renny St, Gordon St and Cook Rd only. 
  • The Moore Park Rd / Fitzroy St cycleway will be closed between Regent St and Oatly Rd from 9pm to 10:30pm to allow for the safe movement of pedestrians to and from the stadium.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and Centennial Park for up to 24-hours, from 12:01am until 11:59pm. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Christmas at the Cathedral will take place over 12 days in the forecourt of St Mary’s Cathedral, from Thursday 14 to Monday 25 December. The event will run each night between 5:30pm and 10:30pm. The night will have food stalls, live entertainment, and a light show.

College St between Prince Albert Rd and Park St outside the Cathedral will remain open throughout the event however road closures may be implemented under Police discretion for crowd safety.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, and watch our for increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Boiler Room Festival at Sydney Showground. Event starts at 3pm and finishes at midnight.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as attendees travel to and from the event.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the interactive map.

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

roads.mainStreet: Edwin Flack Avenue, Kevin Coombs Avenue and Australia Avenue

properties.otherAdvice:
Gabriel Iglesias at Qudos Bank Arena. Show starts around 7pm, finishes approx. 10:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as attendees travel to and from the concert.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the interactive map.

properties.publicTransport: There is no on-site parking available at either golf club, catch transport instead. Shuttle buses will run from Mascot Station, UNSW Light Rail Stop, Royal Randwick Car Park and to the golf courses for the event. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
ISPS HANDA Australian Golf Open from Thursday 30 November to Sunday 3 December. Event takes place at The Australian Golf Club in Rosebery (Thursday to Sunday) and The Lakes Golf Club in Eastlakes (Thursday to Friday).

Traffic may be heavier than usual in Rosebery and Eastlakes during the event. Allow extra travel time.

Road closures, special event clearways and temporary bus zones will be in place for the event:

  • Eastlakes, Thursday and Friday: sections of Vernon Ave, O'Connor St and King St will be closed from 5:30am to 5:30pm each day and clearways will be in effect from 5am to 8pm each day on sections of King St and Vernon Ave.
  • Rosebery and Kensington, Thursday to Sunday: Special event clearways will be in effect between 5am and 8pm daily from Thursday to Sunday on sections of Bannerman Cres and Trevilyan Ave in Rosebery and Tunstall Ave in Kensington.
  • Mascot, Thursday to Sunday: Temporary bus zones (no-parking permitted) will be in effect on the eastern side of Coward St (east of Laycock Walk) and on the eastern side of King St (near Park on King at #336)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:

properties.otherAdvice: The Central Coast Christmas Fair will be held at Mingara Recreation Club on Wyong Road with approximately 5000 attendees expected between 9am and 2pm.

The Cowra Christmas Festival and Night Markets will be held on Friday 1 December 2023 from 6pm to 9pm. The main street of Cowra (Kendall Street) will be closed to traffic and transformed into a Market City. Traffic control will be implemented from 2.30pm to 11pm
properties.diversions: Traffic will be detoured via Fitzroy Street, Vaux Street and Lachlan Street. The detour is suitable for all vehicles.

properties.otherAdvice: The Olympic Highway (Boorowa St) between Thornhill St and Zouch St will be closed for the Young Cherry Festival parade. Diversions will be in place via Dundas St, Thornhill St and Lovell St.

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel public transport, including Major Event Buses. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Foo Fighters at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open 4:15pm, show starts 8pm and finishes around 11pm.

Significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct as a combined crowd of more than 100,000 is expected to attend events in Olympic Park across the evening.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Parking in the precinct will be in high demand and is likely to sell out in advance. Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

The Berrigan Christmas night market is on once again bringing market stalls, and carols by candlelight back to the CBD.

Chanter Street will be closed for the event with detours in place.

Motorists are advised to exercise caution in the area with the expected increase in pedestrian activity.
properties.diversions: Motorists can detour via Drummond St, Corcoran St and Jerilderie St.

properties.otherAdvice:
The 2023 Schools Spectacular will be held at Qudos Bank Arena on Friday and Saturday. Shows start from 11am and 7pm on Friday, and 1pm and 7pm on Saturday. Shows finish by 9:30pm each night.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct during peak travel times, and on Saturday as a festival takes place at neighbouring Sydney Showground from 1pm. Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Rd.

Significant traffic delays are also expected throughout the day on Homebush Bay Drive, Underwood Road and Australia Avenue as bargain hunters travel to DFO Homebush, trading until 7pm.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the interactive map.

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men Sydney derby: Sydney FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at Allianz Stadium. Kick-Off at 7:45pm, finish around 9:30pm.

With up to 30,000 fans traffic delays are expected on roads approaching Moore Park.

Motorists should expect delays and allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Road & Cycleway closures

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:15pm and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave however access to EP3 grass car park, EP2 car park and drop off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd. Car parks open from 4:45pm. Please note EP2 parking is very limited due to upgrade works.
  • Closures may be in place on the Moore Park Rd / Fitzroy St cycleway before and after the game to allow for the safe movement of pedestrians to and from the stadium.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Bridge 2 Bridge Water Ski Classic will be held from 7:30am until 3pm Saturday and Sunday. The Hawkesbury River will be exclusively used for the event.

On Sunday only, ferry services will be suspended at the following times while the race is underway:

  • Wisemans Ferry closure from 8:30am - 12pm
  • Webbs Creek Ferry closure from 8:30am - 12pm
  • Lower Portland Ferry closure from 8:30am - 12:30pm
  • Sackville Ferry closure from 8:30am - 1pm

Motorists travelling through the area should allow additional travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers.

Women's Big Bash League Double Header at the SCG: Hobart Hurricanes v Adelaide Strikers from 10:10am. Sydney Sixers v Sydney Thunder from 1:40pm, finish around 4:40pm.
